titlestmt.titleproper: Patrick Center for Environmental Research records related to the Fairmount Park Commission 1997-2002
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Patrick Center for Environmental Research records related to the Fairmount Park Commission

bioghist.p: Named in honor of Dr. Ruth Patrick, the Patrick Center for Environmental Research at the Academy of Natural Sciences consists of a multidisciplinary group of environmental scientists and engineers devoted to understanding aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems, including the effects of natural processes and human activities on environmental quality. In an effort to restore, renew, and protect one of the largest municipal parks in the U.S. for future generations, the Fairmount Park Commission selected The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia to work on the Natural Lands Restoration and Environmental Education Program (NLREEP). This five-year special initiative was initially funded by a $26 million grant from the William Penn Foundation. NLREEP is designed to restore portions of the natural landscape in the seven watershed parks of the Fairmount Park system, including the Wissahickon Park, Cobbs Creek Park, East and West Park, FDR Park, Pennypack Park, Poquessing Park, and Tacony Park. The Academy's team involved the Environmental, Systematic Biology and Public Programs groups of the Academy and scientists from the Morris Arboretum and the Natural Lands Trust and was led by the Patrick Center for Environmental Research.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the work done by the Patrick Center for Environmental Research for the Fairmount Park Commission in 1997 and 1998. Materials include original data sheets, CDs of data sets, field notes, maps, photos, slides, and reports (on paper and on CD). The collection also includes a CD of the final proposal for the FPC, and video and audio tapes of activities related to this project, including meetings and a radio call-in show.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Bicentennial Symposium records (includes some records from 1970 ecological survey of the park).
